Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body, a small sunken discus surrounded by a groove, and a circular base, concave below. The long flat-topped nozzle is decorated with volutes at its junction with the shoulder, and the end is missing. On the left side of the shoulder is a dolphin. Covered with a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q597)
